com.azure.core.amqp

Class Retry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.azure.core.amqp.Retry
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExponentialRetry

    public abstract class Retry
extends Object
    An abstract representation of a policy to govern retrying of messaging operations.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_MAX_RETRY_COUNT
      Default for the maximum number of retry attempts.
      static Duration DEFAULT_RETRY_MAX_BACKOFF
      Default for the maximum time between retry attempts.
      static Duration DEFAULT_RETRY_MIN_BACKOFF
      Default for the minimum time between retry attempts.

      Allows a concrete retry policy implementation to offer a base retry interval to be used in the calculations performed by 'Retry.GetNextRetryInterval'.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Retry

        public Retry(int maxRetryCount)
        Creates a new instance of Retry with the maximum retry count of maxRetryCount
        Parameters:
        maxRetryCount - The maximum number of retries allowed.

    • Method Detail

      • isRetriableException

        public static boolean isRetriableException(Exception exception)
        Check if the existing exception is a retriable exception.
        Parameters:
        exception - An exception that was observed for the operation to be retried.
        Returns:
        true if the exception is a retriable exception, otherwise false.

      • getNoRetry

        public static Retry getNoRetry()
        Creates a Retry policy that does not retry failed requests.
        Returns:
        A new Retry policy that does not retry failed requests.

      • getDefaultRetry

        public static Retry getDefaultRetry()
        Creates a Retry policy that retries failed requests up to 10 times. As the number of retry attempts increase, the period between retry attempts increases.
        Returns:
        A new instance with the default Retry values configured.

      • incrementRetryCount

        public int incrementRetryCount()
        Increments the number of retry attempts and returns the previous number of retry counts.
        Returns:
        The number of retry attempts before it was incremented.

      • getRetryCount

        public int getRetryCount()
        Gets the current number of retry attempts for this instance.
        Returns:
        The current number of retry attempts.

      • resetRetryInterval

        public void resetRetryInterval()
        Resets the number of retry attempts for this instance.

      • getMaxRetryCount

        public int getMaxRetryCount()
        Gets the maximum number of retry attempts that are allowed.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of retry attempts.

      • getNextRetryInterval

        public Duration getNextRetryInterval(Exception lastException,
                                     Duration remainingTime)
        Calculates the amount of time to delay before the next retry attempt.
        Parameters:
        lastException - The last exception that was observed for the operation to be retried.
        remainingTime - The amount of time remaining for the cumulative timeout across retry attempts.
        Returns:
        The amount of time to delay before retrying the associated operation; if null, then the operation is no longer eligible to be retried.

      • calculateNextRetryInterval

        protected abstract Duration calculateNextRetryInterval(Exception lastException,
                                                       Duration remainingTime,
                                                       int baseWaitSeconds,
                                                       int retryCount)
        Allows a concrete retry policy implementation to offer a base retry interval to be used in the calculations performed by 'Retry.GetNextRetryInterval'.
        Parameters:
        lastException - The last exception that was observed for the operation to be retried.
        remainingTime - The amount of time remaining for the cumulative timeout across retry attempts.
        baseWaitSeconds - The number of seconds to base the suggested retry interval on; this should be used as the minimum interval returned under normal circumstances.
        retryCount - The number of retries that have already been attempted.
        Returns:
        The amount of time to delay before retrying the associated operation; if null, then the operation is no longer eligible to be retried.
